Generation I.Red: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: Using its heavy muscles, it throws powerful punches that can send the victim clear over the horizon.
Generation I.Yellow: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pok é mon fires off awesome punches.
Generation I.Stadium: Among its fighting moves is a simultaneous volley of an uppercut, hook, straight and Karate Chop from its four arms.

Generation II.Gold: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
Generation II.Silver: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
Generation II.Crystal: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
Generation II.Stadium 2: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pok é mon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
Generation III.Sapphire: Machamp is known as the Pok é mon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
Generation III.Emerald: It is impossible to defend against punches and chops doled out by its four arms. Its fighting spirit flares up when it faces a tough opponent.
Generation III.FireRed: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
Generation III.LeafGreen: Its superpowerful punches are said to knock the victim flying clear over the horizon.

Generation IV.Diamond: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
Generation IV.Pearl: It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
Generation IV.HeartGold: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.

Generation V.Black: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
Generation V.White: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
Generation V.Black 2: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.
Generation V.White 2: Its four muscled arms slam foes with powerful punches and chops at blinding speed.

Generation VI.X: Its four ruggedly developed arms can launch a flurry of 1,000 punches in just two seconds.
Generation VI.Y: It uses its four powerful arms to pin the limbs of its foe, then throws the victim over the horizon.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Machamp has the power to hurl anything aside. However, trying to do any work requiring care and dexterity causes its arms to get tangled. This Pokémon tends to leap into action before it thinks.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Machamp is known as the Pokémon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.

Generation VII.Sun: It unleashes megaton-level punches that send opponents flying clear over the horizon.
Generation VII.Moon: It can lift heavy loads with the greatest of ease. It can even heft dump trucks. But its clumsy fingers prevent it from doing any precision work.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It grasps its opponents with its four arms and twists them up in an intricate hold. People call it "the Machamp special."
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: With four arms, it can attack and defend simultaneously. It's said to have mastered every martial art in the world.
Generation VII.Let's Go Pikachu: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.
Generation VII.Let's Go Eevee: One arm alone can move mountains. Using all four arms, this Pokémon fires off awesome punches.

Generation VIII.Sword: It quickly swings its four arms to rock its opponents with ceaseless punches and chops from all angles.
Generation VIII.Shield: With four arms that react more quickly than it can think, it can execute many punches at once.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It punches with its four arms at blinding speed. It can launch 1,000 punches in two seconds.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It can knock a train flying with a punch. However, it is terrible at delicate work using its fingers.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: In close combat, its four arms afford it offensive and defensive supremacy. In but a blink, this valiant Pokémon can overwhelm its foes with more than 1,000 blows from its fists.

Generation I.Yellow: Trade Cubone for Machoke in Underground Path (Kanto Routes 5–6) (evolves immediately)
